content: in 2022 mr x and mrs x decided to get a divorce by mutual consent they made agreements regarding their property children and finances they divided their assets including vehicles and financial accounts and agreed on the distribution of loans and debts mrs x will keep the family home and they made arrangements for the mortgage and other costs they also agreed on custody residence and financial contributions for their children they waived any maintenance obligations towards each other and agreed on the taxation of maintenance contributions the agreement will be effective upon the registration of the divorce decree in the family court each party will be responsible for their own litigation costs they confirmed their legal capacity and chose their respective residences for the process a notary confirmed their identities and marital status and informed them of their rights they granted a power of attorney to a notary for tax declarations they requested a copy of the deed and were informed about accessing a digital copy through the notarial deed database and a digital safe provided by fednot they were given a draft instrument at least five working days before signing the document which contained all necessary information the notary explained the entire deed and it was signed by the parties and the notary
